comments:

Uhm, I've gone back to EMF 2.2.0.v200606271057 (from 2.2.1.v200609210005) and now it works! I'm changing "product" to EMF.
The WTP folks need to look at this.  Obviously I can't reproduce this in isolation of WTP, so that's where it needs to start.

Nicol?s, was anything else installed apart from WTP and its prereqs?  The Command interface hasn't changed in quite a long time, so I'm wondering if you have something else installed that's mixing things up.
CDT, profiler, visual editor and hibernate tools.

my guess is hibernate complications. I'm not sure anymore where to get hibernate. Do they provide some version of EMF too? I also know they do some "funny" stuff with classpath (at least googling about it made some brief mention of classpath complications, which I only skim read). 

At any rate, I think the 2.2.0 versions of EMF are the "right" ones to use for WTP 1.5.0 and Eclipse 3.2.0. So, not sure there is a bug here, per se. 
Maybe an early warning. I'll put in 'remind' state, but let us know if there is some on-going problem we can re-produce (and you'd have to include a link to the version of hybernate you use, I'm not that familar with it first hand).
Hibernate tools is in http://tools.hibernate.org/ and their update site is http://download.jboss.org/jbosside/updates/development .
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
Reopening, as resolved bugs in the remind state should not have been automatically closed.
Putting back to the resolved->remind state.
